entries.title: India’s Budget to Test Modi’s Fiscal Resolve Ahead of 2024 Vote
entries.description: India will unveil its budget Wednesday, testing Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s fiscal mettle seen as key to boosting investor sentiment even as it will likely leave less room for handouts a year before he seeks a third term.

entries.title: Turkey May Back Finland’s Bid for NATO Membership, Reject Sweden
entries.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Turkey may ratify only Finland’s bid to join NATO, in a move that could delay Sweden from gaining membership.

entries.title: Trump Confronts 2024 Obstacles as He Returns to Campaign Trail
entries.description: Donald Trump ran headlong into some of the biggest challenges he’ll face in his comeback bid — fading enthusiasm among Republicans looking to move on from the former president and rising rivals for the GOP nomination — as he hit the 2024 campaign trail for the first time.

entries.title: Tunisia Sees Dismal Turnout in Runoff Vote for Tamed Parliament
entries.description: About 11.3% of Tunisia’s electorate took part in Sunday’s runoff vote for a defanged parliament, the latest sign of popular discontent with politics in the North African country that’s mired in economic crisis.

entries.title: Venezuela Opposition Starts Talks for Funds With Spain Meeting
entries.description: Venezuelan opposition representatives met with Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares at the start of a tour through Europe, as they seek to unlock frozen funds to finance a humanitarian deal with the government.

entries.title: Krugman Says Argentina, Brazil’s Joint Currency Is Terrible Idea
entries.description: Nobel-Prize-winning economist Paul Krugman said the proposed currency union between Argentina and Brazil is a “terrible idea” dreamed up by someone with a limited understanding of economics, adding to public criticism of the plan both country’s leaders are pushing.

entries.title: Ilhan Omar Sees GOP Support for Keeping Her Foreign Affairs Seat
entries.description: Democrat Ilhan Omar expressed confidence that she’ll keep her seat on the House Foreign Affairs Committee, saying allegations she is antisemitic are part of efforts by political foes to smear her.

entries.title: Austrian Ruling Party Loses Ground in Key Regional Election
entries.description: The senior party in Austria’s ruling coalition lost votes to right-wing nationalists in a key provincial election, signaling that support for Chancellor Karl Nehammer’s government may be fading.

entries.title: Lima Records Death After Congress Refuses to Expedite Elections
entries.description: Peru’s political turmoil, sparked by Congress’s decision not to bring forward presidential elections, has claimed its first victim in Lima following the death of a demonstrator in the city.

entries.title: McCarthy Says He’ll Meet Biden for Debt Limit Talks on Feb. 1
entries.description: House Speaker Kevin McCarthy and President Joe Biden have agreed to meet on Feb. 1 to discuss raising the US debt ceiling, reducing government spending and avoiding a sovereign default.

entries.title: Ukrainian Soldiers Pictured Arriving in UK for Tank Training
entries.description: Ukrainian soldiers have landed in the UK to learn how to use British Challenger 2 tanks against their Russian invaders.

entries.title: Zahawi Timeline: How the Ex-Minister’s Tax Controversy Played Out
entries.description: Rishi Sunak has sacked Nadhim Zahawi following the conclusion of an ethics inquiry and several days of intense pressure.

entries.title: Reports of Torture, Unfair Trials in Iran Trigger Fresh Alarm Over Fate of Protesters
entries.description: Rights groups warned that several young people, including teenagers who’ve been jailed by Iran for their involvement in anti-government protests, are at risk of being executed, and have been tortured.

entries.title: Israel Mulls Punishing Attacker Families, Arming More Civilians
entries.description: Israel may penalize the families of Palestinian attackers by revoking identity cards and residency if they support the violence, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, after a deadly shooting near a synagogue escalated some of the bloodiest inter-communal violence in years.

entries.title: Nigeria Extends Deadline to Swap Old Currency Notes by 10 Days
entries.description: Nigeria’s central bank extended a deadline for the expiration of higher denomination naira notes to Feb. 10 after long queues developed at banks and commercial activities almost came to a halt for lack of the new currency.

entries.title: Your UK Sunday Briefing: Zahawi Out, BOE Rate Hike Expected
entries.description: Follow us at  @BloombergUK and on  Facebook, and wrap up your day with The Readout newsletter with Allegra Stratton.

entries.title: Scholz Visits South America in a Race With China to Get Lithium
entries.description: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is hoping his trip to Latin America this weekend will help Germany secure additional supplies of the lithium that car giants like Mercedes-Benz Group AG and Volkswagen AG need for their electric-vehicle batteries.

entries.title: Nadhim Zahawi: Child Refugee Who Built Business Fortune Before Political Career
entries.description: Nadhim Zahawi had been charged with preparing the Tories for the next general election, but his sacking as party chairman will only prompt further questions about the Conservatives' electoral fortunes.

entries.title: UK Gives Homebuilders Six Weeks to Pledge Payment for Cladding
entries.description: Builders in the UK will have six weeks to sign a government contract committing them to pay for upgrades of cladding in houses and apartment blocks, cabinet minister Michael Gove said.

entries.title: Boris Johnson Tops List as MPs Declare £8 Million in Outside Earnings
entries.description: MPs have declared £8 million in earnings on top of their parliamentary salaries, with Boris Johnson accounting for more than a quarter of the total.

entries.title: Sunak Fires Zahawi Citing ‘Serious’ Ethics Breach Over Taxes
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak fired Nadhim Zahawi, citing “serious” breaches of ethics rules after revelations about the Conservative Party chairman’s tax affairs made his position untenable.

entries.title: China Gives Conditional Nod to Two Homegrown Covid Antivirals
entries.description: China gave conditional approval for the use of two locally made Covid-19 antivirals as the nation struggles with limited drugs following the end of virus restrictions.

entries.title: 40 People Killed in Bus Accident in Pakistan, Police Say
entries.description: At least 40 people were killed and four others injured Sunday after a speeding mini bus crashed into the pillar of a bridge in Pakistan’s Balochistan province, according to the police.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: N. Korea Calls US Battle Tank Donations ‘Crime’
entries.description: A senior North Korean official slammed the US decision to send Abrams battle tanks to Ukraine to held defend against Russia, following up earlier comments from the sister of leader Kim Jong Un. Pyongyang also denied it’s provided arms to Russia, as the US as claimed.

entries.title: China Resumes Visa Issuance for Japan, Ending Covid Retaliation
entries.description: China will resume issuing visas to Japanese nationals from Sunday, ending some of the retaliatory measures it took against Covid-related curbs on Chinese travelers.

entries.title: ‘We Are Being Levelled Down’: Why the UK’s Wealth Gap Is Widening
entries.description: Spiralling costs and government inertia are blamed for delays in levelling up projects designed to reduce inequality across the country

entries.title: UK’s Power Switch-Off Shows Future for Cleaner Energy Grid
entries.description: For a few hours last week, British consumers were asked to make a choice: keep consuming power as normal or just turn the lights off.

entries.title: Russia’s Footprint Grows in Africa as France Leaves Burkina Faso
entries.description: The former colonial power’s withdrawal leaves a vacuum that the mercenary Wagner Group is eager to fill

entries.title: ‘There Is No Hope Left’: Five Charts Show Tunisia’s Descent
entries.description: When Tunisian President Kais Saied visited a cafe in a working-class district of the capital recently, a group of young men served a terse dose of realism. “There is no hope left,” one said.

entries.title: Thaksin Daughter Says She’s Confident of Landslide Thai Election Win for Her Party
entries.description: Paetongtarn Shinawatra, bidding to follow in the footsteps of her father and aunt in becoming Thai prime minister, is confident her party can achieve a landslide victory at the next elections with better policies to ease the burden of voters.

entries.title: Marcos Approves Philippine Tax Refund Plan for Foreign Tourists
entries.description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. approved a proposal to refund taxes to foreign tourists to boost visitor arrivals in the country.

entries.title: Argentine Leader Expects Mercosur, EU to Close Trade Deal Soon
entries.description: The Mercosur trade group and the European Union will reach a trade agreement soon, Argentine President Alberto Fernandez said Saturday in Buenos Aires, during German Chancellor Olaf Scholz’s visit to the South American nation.

entries.title: Malaysian Party’s Purge of Senior Leaders Fortifies Chief’s Grip
entries.description: Malaysia’s Deputy Prime Minister Ahmad Zahid Hamidi strengthened his hold over one of the nation’s ruling parties after purging or sidelining senior leaders on Friday, but analysts say the move will do little to bolster his bloc’s popularity.

entries.title: Australia’s Chalmers Looks to Revamp Markets, Institutions
entries.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers pledged to deliver “values-based capitalism” in Australia by revamping markets, renovating institutions and urging the private sector to co-invest with the government as the global economy confronts an inflation crisis.

entries.title: Gandhi Walks 2,000 Miles to Challenge Modi in 2024 Election
entries.description: After more than 100 days walking nearly the entire length of India, Rahul Gandhi, scion of the nation’s most famous political dynasty, stood before a shivering crowd in rural Himachal Pradesh as a cheer went up.
